review: It is frustratingly limiting. It serves to put Amazon products in your face, but falls short when you want to see other services.  Yes, it supports Netflix and Plex and so on, but they all feel like second-citizens. You have to go out of your way to use them. They simply don't have the unified experience that Roku provides. You'll get the same experience with the PS3 or XBox, of course, but there you'll also get a few additional features that balance it out a little.The Youtube app is a thin wrapper about the mobile browser interface, and is terrible to use.This stick is, however, pretty good at receiving Miracast, so you can easily make it a big screen for a Nexus phone or tablet, and it will work remarkably well. It will play your Amazon MP3s and shows lyrics, which is neat, but you're mostly out of luck if you have your own music collection. Finally, the collection of screen saver pictures is truly beautiful.  But is that a reason to buy a stick? Probably not.
